etymology.description: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") + 士(士) (shì, "scholar") = two ritual axes, possibly made of jade -> jade tablet
etymology.interpretation: The character 圭(圭) (guī, "jade tablet") depicts two ritual axes, which symbolize an important ceremonial item, potentially constructed from jade. The duplication suggests a significant or special quality, aligning with the prestigious and ceremonial use of jade tablets.

examples.chinese: 博物馆展示了一枚玉圭(博物館展示了一枚玉圭)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn zhǎnshì le yī méi yù guī.
examples.english: The museum displays a jade tablet.

examples.chinese: 工匠精心制作一块玉圭(工匠精心製作一塊玉圭)，传承古代智慧(傳承古代智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng jīngxīn zhìzuò yī kuài yù guī, chuánchéng gǔdài zhìhuì.
examples.english: The artisan meticulously crafted a jade tablet, inheriting the wisdom of ancient times.
